thread.title: 'Daily Mile' brought in to help schoolchildren keep fit
thread.title_full: 'Daily Mile' brought in to help schoolchildren keep fit | Wales - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: 'Daily Mile' brought in to help schoolchildren keep fit
text:
According to health experts, children are supposed to get around an hour's worth of exercise a day.
Pupils at Rhos Street Primary School. So primary schools across Wales are trying to steer pupils attentions away from the white board - and their mobile phones and tablets - to focus on what's called a walking mile.
Walk, run or occasionally skip fifteen minutes and you should have clocked up a nice bit of exercise - we dispatched Rob Shelley to a playground in Ruthin:
Play video Last updated Sat 4 Feb 2017 And Finally North Wales Ruthin
